title: What did i do???
body:
Firstly i apologise in advance if im posting this in the wrong board.

So i had this bad game as Swain....

My team accused me of intentionally feeding when actually i was trying attentively, i refused to acknowledge this so i told them i wasn't feeding on purpose and that i was bad, they started to become toxic towards me and spammed "report swain" at-least over 5 times in this game. i didn't  like this and dropped a few F bombs because all i saw in the chat is toxicity towards me and i don't usually respond to them but this time i got ticked off at them because they weren't helping when i was pinging for ganks to help me. i never said anything outrageous towards them even though they'd probably deserve it.

Anyways most of the people in that game reported me because of my score (most likely) and i got chat banned.
Is there anyway i can appeal this because this is resulting in 'You are ineligible to earn loot due to previous behavioral restrictions.' and im unable to get keys, boxes or seasonal rewards even though i didn't actually do anything wrong

replies.body:
The short version is, responding to verbal abuse with verbal abuse is still verbal abuse on your part, and therefore still punishable, regardless of who started it.

 [**Punishments generally follow a basic escalation path:**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-)

* ** First Offense:** 10 Game Chat Restriction

* **Second Offense:** 25 Game Chat Restriction

* **Third Offense: **Two Week Suspension

* **Fourth Offense: **Permanent Suspension

It is possible to skip tiers depending on the behaviour.
___
> Anyways most of the people in that game reported me because of my score (most likely) and i got chat banned.

Intent feeding will net you an instant 14 day ban, and that isn't what you were punished for. Chat bans are for verbal negativity, not in game behaviour.
___
> Is there anyway i can appeal this

You can appeal the punishment by [**submitting a support ticket**](http://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), but the punishment was not made in error it won't be revoked.
___
>  this is resulting in 'You are ineligible to earn loot due to previous behavioural restrictions.' and im unable to get keys, boxes

[Once your punishment ends, you'll enter a reform period, during which you'll remain ineligible to earn Hextech Chests and Keys. Ending this reform period requires consistent displays of good sportsmanship. Your reform period isn't over after a specific number of games, or after a certain date, but is completely dependent upon your behavior.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209939463-Hextech-Crafting-Restrictions)

> or seasonal rewards

[**These were the conditions for the 2015 season:**](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/2015-ranked-season-draws-close)

* Players with bans or chat/ranked restrictions active when the season ends are ineligible for this year’s rewards

* Players banned for seven days or more in the three months prior to the end of the season (August 10) are ineligible for this year’s rewards.

* Players banned for boosting during the 2015 season remain ineligible for rewards

* Players who experienced fraud-related and erroneous bans will still be eligible

Which if memory serves are a little different from the conditions from 2014, so they may change a little this year, but I imagine not much. Basically, chances are good that if you face no more punishments this season you will still be eligible for season rewards.

___
> even though i didn't actually do anything wrong

As far as the system is concerned (and it's the community that decides what's acceptable and not by what they choose to report), defending yourself is fine, but retaliation is not. Responding to negativity with negativity just makes more of it, it doesn't make anything better.

If you're unsure about what exactly you said that was punishable, feel free to post the logs here and we can give you a bit of insight.
___
> i don't usually respond to them

It truly is frustrating having to play with that kind of behaviour, but this is the best approach you can have. Anything and everything you say will only be used as fuel for the fire when it comes to these kind of people, and responding in kind only opens you up to punishment as well. Ignoring them completely is the best option. If you feel you struggle with it then you could consider muting all at the start of each game, or moving your chat off screen, or if you find you mostly encounter it on the enemy team you can turn all chat off.
___
A chat restriction at this stage is basically a warning. It's telling you that some element of your behaviour was deemed unacceptable, and that you need to do something about it or you will face further punishments. Fourth offence (or less depending on the severity of the behaviour) is a permanent account suspension, so just consider that.

However, if you demonstrate [**good behaviour**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751874-Behavior-Worthy-of-a-Champion) for [**3 months**](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/f/mNBeEEkI/d/p7scKW1K?comment=00050000000000000000) you will drop your account down a punishment tier, in your case that would put your account back into good standing, so good luck to you, and I hope things go better in the future.
Can you tell me more about the reform period, i am really eager to get this restriction gone asap

The time frame of the reform period is different for each player, so I don't really have any more idea than you on a timeframe. That said, there was a post here on boards where a player said they got rewards back in about a week after their punishment ended with good behaviour.

As far as the system is concerned (and it's the community that decides what's acceptable and not by what they choose to report), defending yourself is fine, but retaliation is not.  This doesn't make any sense. The toxic players who are reporting him shouldn't get to decide what's acceptable and if anything aren't classed as members of our community anymore. 

-Yes, people should ignore/mute instead of retaliation, BUT retaliation is almost the same as defending yourself. It's sad how you're considering toxic players reports against innocent victims. Fueling a toxic player is your excuse for making the situation worse, the match is already ruined having the toxic person playing on the same rift in the first place. The fun is already over for everyone. The damage is done, him retaliating is only a result in the toxic community.  

-What i'm trying to say is stop punishing the innocent it's only going to create more toxicity in the community. You think that you're solving it but you're actually fueling the fire even more. It's a domino effect, many players get pissed off being punished unfairly and then go on to being toxic trolls venting out their frustration on others, THEN the player victims of them retaliate = get a punishment, so on and so forth.

As far as I can tell, this community is just full of C*n*t*.

No matter what you do, if you come across a premade group, and the large the worse, you are in for some strife.

The best thing to do is just mute them, as much as I don't like doing that, it is for the better of yourself in most cases. Although you may still be reported for feeding because they are %%%%s.
I have looked at the chat log, i don't see anything that unreasonable to get me chat banned
